a190a2299f464789ce3270850f4ac49d (12:59): but im missing the piece that turns the jQuery.fn.jQuery.init object into the jQuery object
0de37da1d654c10aed33d7b7347b8e3b (13:00): it's basically all elaborations on what happens in "if ( selector.nodeType ) { ..."
a190a2299f464789ce3270850f4ac49d (13:01): and i exactly copied it, but it doesnt work :(
0de37da1d654c10aed33d7b7347b8e3b (13:01): it finds elements, stashes them in "this", which is the actual jquery object, then as last step turned them inot an array using makeArray
0de37da1d654c10aed33d7b7347b8e3b (13:01): *turns them into
a190a2299f464789ce3270850f4ac49d (13:01): doesnt init return at the and of the selector.nodeType if statement?

0de37da1d654c10aed33d7b7347b8e3b (13:08): might want to add a little text to explain what this page does so people don't go "there's nothing on this page" and close it.
0de37da1d654c10aed33d7b7347b8e3b (13:08): yeah, but the meter moves slowly, and the few second or two you don't see it move so you think is broken.
0de37da1d654c10aed33d7b7347b8e3b (13:09): and then it silently broke
0de37da1d654c10aed33d7b7347b8e3b (13:09): the music keeps playing, but the visualisation stopped doing anything
5f576bb99d0506e30fae7b66d5ec7d03 (13:10): reload
5f576bb99d0506e30fae7b66d5ec7d03 (13:10): idk why it does that
0de37da1d654c10aed33d7b7347b8e3b (13:10): then there is some more debugging to do
0de37da1d654c10aed33d7b7347b8e3b (13:11): still probably a good idea to add some text to your page to explain what's going on.
0de37da1d654c10aed33d7b7347b8e3b (13:11): awesome comes with something to explain why it's awesome =)
0de37da1d654c10aed33d7b7347b8e3b (13:12): not really an explanation, more a one liner =)
5f576bb99d0506e30fae7b66d5ec7d03 (13:12): i will make so people can open their own files
5f576bb99d0506e30fae7b66d5ec7d03 (13:12): still, there is no way to get a progress of decoding audio :/
0de37da1d654c10aed33d7b7347b8e3b (13:15): if you can decode in chunks, you can use timeout iteration with 10ms intervals, so the page gets updated after each chunk
0de37da1d654c10aed33d7b7347b8e3b (13:15): rather than doing it all in one function and the page no updating while that function runs
5f576bb99d0506e30fae7b66d5ec7d03 (13:18): really?

0de37da1d654c10aed33d7b7347b8e3b (13:20): yeah, if you use timeouts to go to the next iteration, you're letting the JS engine notify the browser that there's a "dead moment" that it can use to deal with some of the other work that has been queued for it
5f576bb99d0506e30fae7b66d5ec7d03 (13:20): how do i chunk an mp3? :P
0de37da1d654c10aed33d7b7347b8e3b (13:20): it has the benefit of keepinng a page responsive, instead of locked while a long function runs
5f576bb99d0506e30fae7b66d5ec7d03 (13:20): i know
0de37da1d654c10aed33d7b7347b8e3b (13:21): isn't mp3 data chunk-based?
5f576bb99d0506e30fae7b66d5ec7d03 (13:23): 0de37da1d654c10aed33d7b7347b8e3b: the page dont get unresponsive
5f576bb99d0506e30fae7b66d5ec7d03 (13:23): the decoding is async
5f576bb99d0506e30fae7b66d5ec7d03 (13:23): i just want to know the progress :P

0de37da1d654c10aed33d7b7347b8e3b (13:25): yes, which is my point. If you're running something asynchronous but it's one block of code with some "page.updateProgess()" call, with the function not returning until it's done parsing, you can call page.updateProgess as much as you link, you won't see the results until the function returns because the render engine never gets a chance to update the page
0de37da1d654c10aed33d7b7347b8e3b (13:25): *as much as you like
0de37da1d654c10aed33d7b7347b8e3b (13:28): paul_irish_: running into a *really* weird bug with Chrome, want to see if it's justd me or a general problem? =)
